thread.title: Missing Melbourne mother Karen Ristevski confirmed dead
thread.title_full: Missing Melbourne mother Karen Ristevski confirmed dead

author: Cameron Houston and Marissa Calligeros
title: Missing Melbourne mother Karen Ristevski confirmed dead
text:
Missing Melbourne mother Karen Ristevski confirmed dead CAMERON HOUSTON AND MARISSA CALLIGEROS Last updated 20:29, February 21 2017 Supplied/The Age 
Karen Ristevski, seen here with her husband Borce and daughter Sarah. 
The body of missing Melbourne mother Karen Ristevski has been found, seven months after she disappeared. 
Police have confirmed the human remains found in bushland at the base of Mount Macedon in Victoria, Australia on Monday belong to Ristevski, who was born in Wellington, but left New Zealand as a child. 
The 47-year-old mother was last seen at her Avondale Heights home in Melbourne's north-west by her husband Borce Ristevski on June 29, 2016. 
The body was found 25 kilometres from the area where police last searched for Ristevski in December 2016. 
It appeared the body was found between the trunks of two fallen trees about 50 metres from Loch Road in Macedon Regional Park. 
Two plain-clothes detectives visited the family home in Avondale Heights shortly before 5pm on Tuesday (local time). Detectives leave the home of missing woman Karen Ristevski alone. A women's body was found at Macedon on Monday @theage pic.twitter.com/UGxo8UTyoH â€” Chloe Booker (@chloebooker) February 21, 2017 
They left alone about 5.45pm. 
More to follow.
